qas.question: Without what could morale collapse occur according to Arthur Harris?

answers.text: without the destruction of the German economy.

qas.question: What was the primary strategy for Bomber Command offensives?

answers.text: to destroy the German industrial base (economic warfare), and in doing so reduce morale

qas.question: Arthur Harris announced that Bomber Command would enable economic warfare to achieve what?

answers.text: "a state of devastation in which surrender is inevitable."

context: AOC Bomber Command Arthur Harris did see German morale as a major objective. However, he did not believe that the morale-collapse could occur <a0_0>without the destruction of the German economy.<a0_0/> The primary goal of Bomber Command's offensives was <a1_0>to destroy the German industrial base (economic warfare), and in doing so reduce morale<a1_0/>. In late 1943, just before the Battle of Berlin, he declared the power of Bomber Command would enable it to achieve <a2_0>"a state of devastation in which surrender is inevitable."<a2_0/> A summary of Harris' strategic intentions was clear:
